B.text: Rattle foe a little. Bruise his elbow.

C.text: Strike glances off foe. He presses on.

D.text: Strike lands without force. Foe is up.

E.text: How foe evaded that blow is a mystery.

A.text: It looks solid, but foe is not hindered.

B.text: Bump foe in the chest. He loses a garment decoration.

C.text: Foe turns to evade and gets hit in the backside. Little damage is done.

D.text: Wild assault to shoulder fails to connect with foe.

E.text: Foe is unbalanced and gives ground to regain his footing.

A.text: With great effort foe evades the damage. You have initiative.

B.text: Corrupt foe's sense of balance. He stumbles and loses the initiative.

C.text: Firm strike causes foe to step back and get his bearings.

D.text: Strike to chest is not hard but it is well placed. Foe steps back 5 feet.

E.text: Foe staggers back and trips, making things worse for him.

A.text: Spin foe sideways. He recovers quickly. You have the initiative.

B.text: Foe's response is quick enough to avoid serious damage.

C.text: Strong blow. Foe abandons any hope of the initiative and falls back.

D.text: Foe starts stepping away from the assault before it hits his legs.

E.text: Foe fails to avoid some of the attack and almost falls down.

A.text: Your strike has some effect. Foe loses his balance and cannot regain a good stance. You have 2 rounds of initiative.

B.text: Strike seeks foe's head. He blocks with his weapon and evades with shameless grace. He keeps his guard up.

C.text: Foe is unbalanced and can only manage some wild swings to protect himself for the moment.

D.text: Blow almost sends foe down. He strikes the ground with his weapon while trying to regain his balance.

E.text: Foe reels from this deadly strike. He avoids death but not damage. His side is badly bruised.

A.text: Foe must give ground or fall. He steps back 5 ft and goes low to avoid falling. He loses 2 rnds of initiative.

B.text: Violent blow to shield side. Any shield is destroyed. Foe's side is bruised. He is still on his feet.

C.text: Pitiless blow to foe's lower leg. Foe is desperate to defend himself while he regains his balance.

D.text: Boom! Foe is hammered by an effective strike to his back. He looks to be recovering. Minor bruises.

E.text: Hammer foe in shoulder. He falls 10 feet and spuins around. He stumbles another 5 ft before regaining control.

A.text: A solid shot unnerves foe and knocks him to the side. His recovery is slow. You have 3 rounds of initiative.

B.text: Foe loses footing before being struck, but still avoids most of assault. A piece of equipment is knocked loose.

C.text: Foe's weapon arm is slammed into his chest. Foe almost falls. He steps back 5 feet and regains some footing.

D.text: Foe is shaken and steps back 5 feet for the next 2 rounds. If he cannot step back he falls down.

E.text: Foe is lifted off the ground and thrown back five feet. Amazingly he does not fall. His guard is down.

A.text: Bash to foe's side damages equipment unbalancing him. He stumbles about.

B.text: Smash foe to side. Foe still fights but footing is unfirm and armor is loose.

C.text: Hard strike to side, armor does not help. The bruise is deep and effective.

D.text: Batter foe. He fumbles his weapon grip. He notices little else right now.

E.text: Foe tries to withstand blow, but goes down. He takes 2 rnds to stand.

A.text: Foe's shield arm is roughed up. Foe puts his guard up and steps back. It is clear he is dazed.

B.text: Foe's response is ungraceful. The strike slams his weapon arm into his side and pins it for the moment.

C.text: Strong bash hits foe low. His legs almost give with the pain. Foe recoils 5 feet away from your assault.

D.text: Concussion bruises skin and batters ribs. Foe is numb, unable to feel the damage. He thinks wound is mortal.

E.text: Impact scatters unattached equipment. Shield, helmet, and any weapons go flying. Foe then falls down.

A.text: Well placed. Strike slams into foe's weapon arm. Foe holds onto his weapon .

B.text: Blow crashes into foe's chest. If he has chest armor, it is damaged. If not, he has terrible bruises and cracked ribs.

C.text: Crashing blow to foe's shoulder sends him over. He uses weapon arm to stay standing and cannot defend himself.

D.text: Lay waste to foe's shield arm. Any shield in use takes some of the damage, but is destroyed by impact.

E.text: Your strike vandalizes foe's sense of balance and he crashes to the ground. His legs and pride are bruised.

A.text: Foe braced poorly for the impact. His knee is pressed backwards damaging muscles and tendons.

B.text: Fingers are entangled in the impact and broken. Foe's shield hand is useless. The swelling might go away in a day.

C.text: Blast breaks shield arm. He falls on his weapon arm and breaks his wrist. Both arms are useless. Talk about bad luck.

D.text: Snap foe's head back. Foe falls unconscious onto ground breaking a leg and hand. Without helm he dies .

E.text: Head strike. Foe's skull is crushed. Any helmet worn is driven into the side of foe's head.

A.text: Foe's evasion attempt exposes back and side. Impact causes foe to drop his guard and stumble to the side.

B.text: Blow to back flings foe to knees. He drops his weapon. He stands but his guard is down as he rearms himself.

C.text: A piece of solid equipment is jammed into foe's chest. The pain is sharp. It leaves a permanent bruise.

D.text: Foe is knocked down. He lands on his equipment, and drops his weapon. He cannot get up for 2 rounds.

E.text: Strike impacts along thigh. Leg is twisted and muscles pulled. Foe jams a finger during the struggle.

A.text: Modest strike provides some excellent openings. If foe has a shield, it is out of position for 1 round.

B.text: Solid strike to shoulder numbs foe's senses and bruises muscles. Foe's sense of direction is off.

C.text: Violent strike to foe's midsection. He falls, drops equipment, and is vulnerable while standing up.

D.text: Strike at foe's legs. Foe wisely leaps back from the strike. Both shins and knees are bruised his ankle is broken.

E.text: Strike lands in center of foe's chest. Foe is knocked down. Chest armor is destroyed. Ribs are broken.

A.text: Strke lands hard against foe's shield side. He almost loses his footing. Foe will fall against any nearby object.

B.text: Your irresistible blow sends foe onto his back. He drops his weapon. Foe has a variety of bruises.

C.text: Sweep foe onto his back. Foe must roll over to get up. Leg armor will slow him down. Minor fracture on lower leg.

D.text: Fold up foe's weapon arm and snap it against his body like a twig. His arm is useless. Boy that must hurt!

E.text: Strike crashes into foe's side, breaking his shoulder and collar bone. One arm is useless; the other isn't much better.

A.text: Solid shot to foe's chest drives home a deep bruise. The wound is unforgiving. Ribs are cracked and cartilage is torn.

B.text: Brutal strike lands between foe's shoulder blades. Tendons and muscles sprain. Little is not painful for foe.

C.text: Strike looks harmless. However, foe's collarbone is broken. He is furious with his fortune. The pain is real.

D.text: Impact to face and chest knocks out teeth and breaks ribs. Foe is dazed and stands immobile for 3 rounds.

E.text: Violent onslaught ruptures organs and causes massive internal bleeding. Foe will die in 6 inactive rounds.

A.text: Assault to legs. Foe's balance is stolen. He falls to the ground. Foe's shin and knee are bashed against the ground.

B.text: Strike flings its strength into foe's legs. Muscles are bruised and tendons are torn. Foe remains standing. One of foe's greaves comes off.

C.text: Blow fractures foe's thigh. Foe does not fall down, but he cannot walk until the leg has a splint. This is a good opportunity to practice your first aid.

D.text: Onslaught to foe's midsection. Organs are damaged and foe throws up blood. Foe's abdomen is seriously damaged. He falls and should not be moved.

metadata.DESC: Without abdominal armor, dies in 6 rounds

E.text: Foe is thrown down. Two ribs protrude from his chest. Organs are destroyed. Foe's eyes glaze when death comes in 3 rnds.

A.text: Blow to foe's head. If he has a helmet, it is unseated and covers foe's eyes. If no helmet, foe is knocked out.

B.text: Strike hammers side of head. With helmet, foe is in coma for 2 weeks. If no helm, foe diesin 1-10 rnds.

C.text: Force of attack breaks foe's knee and sends him down. He can't get up unassisted. He considers surrendering.

D.text: Foe's face, jaw and neck shatter. He stumbles back a few steps. He falls and dies after 3 rounds of inactivity. Sad.

E.text: Foe's lower body is crushed. Massive blood loss and shock will cause foe to die after 6 rounds. He can still speak.

A.text: Blow lands hardest against foe's hip. The bone is fractured and foe falls down. Foe sprains wrist in the fall. When it rains, it pours.

B.text: This sudden tempest breaks foe's neck. He cannot breath. He drops and dies after a futile 12 round struggle. Close his eyes.

C.text: Savage impact ruptures internal organs and breaks many bones. Foe falls and dies..

D.text: Bash in foe's side. Bones are broken by the concussion. One of them is driven into a kidney. Foe goes into shock, drops, and dies in 8 rounds.

E.text: Strike brings foe down. His spine is broken with liitle effort. Foe is still. Blood pours from his mouth heralding his death. He dies in 3 rounds.

A.text: Foe slams to ground from brutal strike. His rib cage is fractured. With armor, he is only knocked out; if no armor, foe dies in 3 rnds from internal bleeding.

B.text: Bash in foe's side and a shoulder. The shoulder blade violently contacts foe's spine. Foe is paralyzed from the shoulder down. Foe is unhappy.

C.text: Foe's head is in the middle of this tumult. Foe dies instantly. His skull is crushed and a few other bones are also broken in his fall.

D.text: Crush foe's lungs and heart with an irresistible onslaught. The impact slams foe to the ground and he dies a moment later.

E.text: Blast breaks close to thirty bones in foe's skeleton. He is dead a moment later. His body is difficult to gather up. Very little of his equipment in intact.
